required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PRELUDE:Study to Investigate the Prevention of Relapse in Lymphoma Using Daily Enzastaurin
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Clinical Study to Investigate the Prevention of Relapse in Lymphoma Using Daily Enzastaurin

brief_summary.textblock:
This clinical research study is to investigate the prevention of relapse in patients with diffuse large B cell lymphoma (DLBCL) using enzastaurin daily.
This is a randomised trial which compares Enzastaurin to Placebo (dummy treatment), the chance of receiving Enzastaurin is 2 to 1.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to objective progression, start of new therapy or death from any cause
baseline to date of death from any cause
baseline, every other cycle until 1 year, 18 months, 24 months

intervention.description: 1125 mg loading dose then 500 mg, oral, daily, until disease progression or maximum of 3 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of diffuse large B cell lymphoma
- Recently completed R-CHOP therapy and achieved remission
- IPI score 3,4,5
- At least 18 years of age
- Agree to study follow-up schedule
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received therapy other than R-CHOP for lymphoma
- Serious medical condition such as infection,second cancer,heart disease
- Received radiation to more than one lesion
- Unable to swallow tablets
